Getting started

24 April 2018

Getting started on a new thing can be daunting. Here’s just a thing to test the category system I cobbled together.

I have to do a lot of legwork here, since Jekyll is pretty unfamiliar to me still, so I have to get used to the yaml-based metadata system and all that.

I implemented a basic categorical system with preset layouts for the categories, as outlined in online resources on Jekyll blogging. I also added categorical next-prev functionality, probably in a very cumbersome way. I’ll update this post with some details post haste, once I see that the system actually works.

  • So, my CSS is broken when it comes to blockquotes- let’s fix that.

  • So, it seems that choosing MDL as my frontend library is a bit of a chore. But never fear, I do like troubleshooting things. MDL is great for things like this, where I’m just trying to make a vary small thing and don’t really need anything heavy. MDL is easy to use, but a bit cumbersome with the JS, so let’s see what this looks like with the js taken out–

  • Also, just a heads up, I’ll be switching over to Surface. It seems much much better, CSS only and just as good-looking! Holy shit!

Yeah, tweaking this thing is just simply much more interesting than actually writing posts or having anything useful to say.

That’s the curse of being into web design- it’s much more fun to build stuff than to use a finished platform.

Written with StackEdit.
